H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H4931.def: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H3320.def: = action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H2377.def: = series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment

H874.def: = action by which some content is expressed in words or written in such a way that it may be simple to understand

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H2377.def: = series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H6315.def: = causative action by which deities or forces cause air to blow from one place to another

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4102.def: = action by which humans defer action, either out of indecision or because something else needs to happen first

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H309.def: = process by which an event happens later than expected

H6075.def: literally: to be swollen; hence: = state in which humans think highly of themselves without sufficient reason

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H3093.def: = pertaining to a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly, especially with one's mouth; ≈ seen as a condition that cannot last

H5115.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = process by which humans are alive and well

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

26.gl: to enlarge (one's) self > to be excessively greedy

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4426.def: = words that express insolence and contempt for someone else

H2420.def: = action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well-formulated and that require wisdom to be understood

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H5391.def: = action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

H6621.def: = a very short interval of time

H2111.def: = process by which (part of) the body of humans shakes or trembles violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear, respect, or old age

H3364.def: = process by which humans wake up from sleep

H4933.def: = all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1214.def: = causative action by which someone severs a link between one object and a larger object of which it used to be a part

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7064.def: = structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7096.def: = causative action by which humans remove part of an object with a sharp tool

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H7023.def: = flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space

H3714.def: exact meaning uncertain; possibly = a part of a building used to support the roof, like a rafter or a beam

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H1767.def: = state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H3286.def: = process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity

H7385.def: = state in which a container does not contain anything

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4589.def: = state of being naked, ≈ commonly associated with shame

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3563.def: = small, bowl-shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H7022.def: according to {A:HOTTP} this is a play upon words mixing the ideas of {L:shame<SDBH:קָלֹון>} and {L:vomiting:<SDBH:קיא>} = state in which humans experience disdain from the general public ◄ due to their condition

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H6459.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H6458.def: = causative action by which humans create objects out of wood or stone

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3336.def: = an object produced by humans or deities, ◄ described as an artifact shaped from clay by an artisan

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H457.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless

H483.def: = state in which humans or animals are unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H1748.def: = state in which someone refrains from speaking

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H1964.def: = a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2013.def: = action by which humans stop talking
